news_header: Noho Partners acquires majority stake in eight restaurants in Tampere.
news_text: Finnish restaurant company Noho Partners has purchased a majority of H5 Restaurants' business, which includes eight restaurants in Tampere: H5 Bar&Cellar, Pub Kujakolli, Restaurant Härlem, Restaurant Pons, The Red Lion Pub, Restaurant Tuoppi, Beerhouse Opaali, and the sports bar Kultainen Ilves. The combined annual revenue of these restaurants exceeds eight million euros. As part of the deal, Noho's owned restaurant Patarouva will also join H5 Restaurants. Marko Meronen, the entrepreneur of H5 Restaurants, stated that the acquisition ensures a positive trajectory for the business by leveraging Noho's expertise and synergy benefits. Established in 1996, Noho Partners specializes in restaurant services and operates around 300 restaurants in Finland, Denmark, Norway, and Switzerland.
